Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gilbear H Valdez Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision fees.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
---------------------------

No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior agent approval. 
---------------------------

Enter into and successfully complete sex offender treatment. Comply with requirements of sex offender registry. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------

Original Order to Produce filed with Court.

Post Conviction Motion Hearing before the Honorable Kristine Drettwan on April 13, 2018
Court Reporter Sandy Elderbrook
Notice of Appeal and Circuit Court Record
Appeals Document Index saved for: 2018AP000860 by: Margo Grabner
from Judgment of Conviction entered on September 1, 2015 and the Order Denying Motion for Postconviction Relief entered on April 17, 2018.
Atty Ana Babcock
Order Denying postconviction relief
Ex #4 held in Exhibit Room

9:01 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DA Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Defendant Gilbear H Valdez in court, in custody with Atty Ana L. Babcock.  
Matter is before the Court on Motions for Post Conviction Relief that have been filed requesting Court to reconsider Shiffra Green and second, alleging ineffective assistance of trial counsel.  
Atty Babcock advises they are withdrawing issue 2B of the Motion.  

Exhibits marked, offered & received:  #1, #2, #3, #4;  

9:30 am  Attorney Travis Schwantes is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Ana Babcock.  
9:48 am  Atty Babcock makes record with regard to the DVD recording of CAC interview.  Atty Wiedenfeld believes that the DVD recording is already part of the Court's record as it was an exhibit at trial.    
9:49 am  Cross exam by Atty Wiedenfeld.  
10:09 am  Redirect by Atty Schwantes.  
10:11 am  No cross by State.  Witness excused.  
10:12 am  Atty Babcock has one procedural matter.  Discussion concerning DVD interview of child.  Both parties are in agreement to have it marked as an exhibit and received.  State is requesting the DVD interview be sealed.  Atty Babcock does not have a position on this.  Court will seal Exhibit 4 but makes further record that the Exhibit would be accessible to the prosecution or any defense counsel as well as to any appellate court should they wish to view it.  
10:15 am  Argument by Atty Babcock.  
10:22 am  Response by Atty Babcock to Court's question.  
10:22 am  Argument by Atty Wiedenfeld.  
10:29 am  Rebuttal argument by Atty Babcock.  
10:30 am  Court takes short recess.  

10:38 am  Court in session.  Same appearances.  Court deals with first issue regarding reconsideration of Shiffra-Green motion.  This Court's decision is no different than that made by the trial court.  Court does not think defense has met burden under Shiffra-Green for an in camera.  Court next addresses the 2nd issue of the Motion.  First allegation is that Atty Schwantes was ineffective because he did not play video of deft's interview with detective.  Court makes record and does not find counsel was deficient.  Court denies that prong of defense motion.  Court makes record as to the next prong of defense Motion.  Court denies that part of the motion as well.  Court declines to find that Atty Schwantes was ineffective and declines reconsideration of Shiffra Green request.  Atty Babcock will submit Order.  11:06 am Court in recess.  
11:07 am  Court makes record that Exhibit 3 will be sealed.  Atty Babcock advises that when she filed the Motion, it (Exhibit 3) was attached to the Motion and the Court denied request to seal that attachment.  Court will now order that attachment to the motion to be sealed.  
11:08 am  Court in recess.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 5/11/18: COURT REPORTER SANDY ELDERBROOK**
State's Brief in Response to Def's Postconviction Motion

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that a WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30 postconviction motion shall be filled in the circuit no later than January 3, 2018.

Defendant Gilbear H Valdez in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
*TRANSCRIPT FILED 08/09/2016 - Court Reporter: Rhonda S. Boss

Defendant Gilbear H Valdez in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties confirm that they are ready to proceed to trial on Monday.  Neither side has any pre-trial issues.  State will try to file the Jury Instructions by noon on Friday - but must be filed by Monday morning at the latest.  Court asks that the Attorneys and Mr. Valdez be present in Court at 8:30 a.m. on Monday morning.  Jurors will be asked to report at 8:15 a.m.   Discussion concerning Motion to exclude witnesses from the courtroom.  Court grants Motion.  State's Court Office may remain in the courtroom.  It is unknown at this time whether the victim wishes to remain in the courtroom.  Argument by Attorney Schwantes with regard to exclusion.  Court will readdress this on Monday morning prior to the start of the trial.

Must post $2000.00 cash.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT D.R.O. (6/19/2001) OR A.J.L. (5/21/2008). NO CONTACT WITH ANY JUVENILES EXCEPT INCIDENTAL.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
